# Winter's Celestial Showcase
## Scripture
"For the creation was subjected to frustration, not by its own choice, but by the will of the one who subjected it, in hope that the creation itself will be liberated from its bondage to decay and brought into the freedom and glory of the children of God." - Romans 8:20-21

## Reflection
As we gaze up at the winter night sky, we're met with a celestial showcase of twinkling stars, constellations, and planets. The cold, dark months can often feel barren and lifeless, but the heavens declare a different story. The creation, though subjected to frustration and decay, holds onto the hope of liberation and glory. Just as the earth waits for the promise of spring, we wait for the fulfillment of God's promises in our lives. The winter sky, with its stark beauty, reminds us that even in seasons of decay, God's glory and freedom are on the horizon.

## Prayer
Dear Heavenly Father, as we navigate the darkness of winter, help us to fix our eyes on the celestial showcase above. May the twinkling stars and constellations remind us of your promise to liberate creation from decay and bring us into the freedom and glory of your children. Fill us with hope and anticipation, that we may wait patiently for the fulfillment of your promises in our lives. May your glory shine brightly in our hearts, even in the darkest of seasons. Amen.
